//: Provides plot hooks and missions arcs

job_description: I work with the staff at the refugee center to fight the Xenoids.

yes: Hey there. What did you break?
Oh, hey. What did you do now?
dynamic_line.no: I don't think I've seen you wander in here before. I'm Randy. Close the door behind you when you leave.

responses.text: Wow, nice to meet you too, Randy.
Hi, Randy.  Got a second to talk?
Hey Randy, nice to meet you too.  Bye.
Hi Randy.  I don't have time to talk.

dynamic_line: I don't usually get any visitors back here unless the lights aren't working.  What do you want?  Did you trip over a cord or something.

responses.text: No, I just had some questions.
Actually I'm just heading out. Bye.

dynamic_line: I don't have forever to chat, whatchya need?
I'm pretty busy but could probably help.

responses.text: I'm trying to put a cleanup crew together to tidy up the back room.  Can you help?
[RP] What is that stuff on the table?
That is a very nice watch.
That is a very nice watch.
So how did you end up here?
So what are you doing here?
Is there anything I can do to help you out?
About that mission…
Don't mind me…

dynamic_line: I was trying to get in contact with the rest of my family because I'd figure that if anyone would be fighting alien invaders it would be my uncle.  But when it came down to it I ended using my last full magazine to drop half a dozen strays a pair of xenoids that were about to kill me.  Then, I ran here as quick as my feet could carry me and now I'm stuck here in the ruins of this public school, doing the best I can to help these guys keep the lights on.  I could probably rendezvous with my family if I wanted, but I want to make sure these people here are safe before I'd even consider leaving this place.  The people are here are nice and this place kind of grows on you.

responses.text: Its good that you like it here.
Ok, see you later.

dynamic_line.yes: Now that the generator is fixed, I finally beat my record length playing Snake.  I also have time to finish reading 'Roadside Picnic'.  Thanks again, stalker.
dynamic_line.no: I've been spending most of my time keeping this jury-rigged generator running just slowly enough to trickle charge the batteries that are built into this old machinery so it can keep these utility lights on at night. It as effective as can be considering what I've got to work with.

responses.text: Something else.
Good luck with that.

dynamic_line: I know right.  I  know a guy on the inside and got mine right before shit really hit the fan.  I just wish all my old friends were still alive so I could brag to them about having the coolest watch.

responses.text: Yeah, me too.
I have to go now.

dynamic_line: I managed to salvage this after I took their gear apart Its unlike anything I've ever seen on earth.  I'm almost certain that the prismetallic plates seem fabricated using 3d-printed, the cloth-like weave more fire-retardant than asbestos, and I don't even know where to start with those damn electronics.

responses.text: That's interesting.
Ok, see you later.

description: Retrieve a decent wrench for Randy Erikson.  Keep an eye out for the other tools he said he might need.

dialogue.describe: I need a real wrench to fix shit around here.
dialogue.offer: I feel silly asking this, but can you find a good wrench?  My multi-tool has been working good for most things, but I could get so much done with a nice adjustable crescent wrench.
dialogue.advice: Remember where you used to go to buy a wrench, try there.  If you see a voltmeter or a soldering iron, grab them too.
dialogue.success: Thanks!  Now I finally feel ready in case this generator decides it wants to commit suicide.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.

description: Randy Erikson said he needs a voltmeter to troubleshoot some electronic machinery.

dialogue.describe: I need a voltmeter to diagnose the electrical system.
dialogue.offer: I hope you listened to my advice on your last mission because now I'm going to need a voltmeter to figure out why there are more warning lights flashing than normal.  Go get one.
dialogue.rejected: I think it will work for now, but who knows when the lights will go out for good?
dialogue.advice: I remember seeing a nice voltmeter at the electronics store in the mall before shit hit the fan.  Try there maybe?
dialogue.success: Thank you so much.  Now lets see what part isn't working.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.

description: Randy Erikson needs a working soldering iron to fix a power control board.

dialogue.describe: I need a soldering to fix the electrical system.
dialogue.offer: I think I figured out which parts of the power control board are acting up. Luckily I have the replacement circuits, but I'm going to need a good soldering iron. You already wouldn't have one would you?
dialogue.rejected: I think it will work for now, but who knows when the lights will go out for good?
dialogue.advice: Didn't you find one at the electronics store in the mall? Go back and pick up some extra solder while you're there.
dialogue.success: Great now I actually have to fix it.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.

name.str: Get a pound of solder wire

description: Randy Erikson needs 225 units of solder to finalize repears of the power control board.

dialogue.offer: I vastly underestimated how much solder I am going to need to fix this thing. I need at least a pound to fix everything that's broken. Do you have that much on you?
dialogue.rejected: I think it will work for now, but who knows when the lights will go out for good?
dialogue.advice: One pound is 225 units of solder wire. Can you remember that number or do you need me to write it down for you too?
dialogue.success: Great now I actually have to fix it.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.

description: Randy Erikson needs a  hardcopy of something called the 'Integrated Circuit Archive Database'.  Might have to see if you can find an internet connection or see if someone saved it on a USB drive.

dialogue.describe: I need the circuit reference documentation.
dialogue.offer: I've gotten all the loose parts fixed and all wires replaced that needed replacing, but to check every circuit I need a hard copy of the 'Integrated Circuit Archive Database', since I can't just ask the internet for that kind of stuff any more.
dialogue.rejected: I need those reference documents to double check everything.
dialogue.advice: I bet a secret government lab has a copy.  It should be on a USB drive somewhere.
dialogue.success: Wow, you actually found it. Here is a book that will help you use the helicopter parked out there.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.

description: Randy Erikson wants a some software that has probably been mislabled.  It was probably useless to begin with.

dialogue.offer: I need another old piece of software, not sure what it was but I'll know it when I see it..
dialogue.advice: I will know it when I check the files on the USB.  Probably got mislabled as miscellaneous or something.
dialogue.success: Finally I have all my favorite mods for Cataclysm DDA, this game is so boring unmodded.  Here is a book you'll really like, plus some paper money the staff here keep giving me.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do me?
dialogue.failure: It's okay.  I didn't really expect you to succeed anyway.
